content: Just turned 22 and reflecting on the past year's lessons. Life's a puzzle, and I'm piecing together my career in DeFi. Spent the day diving into Solana's documentation, prepping for that interview.
Had a long session with my DeFi mentor. Discussed smart contract security at length. There's so much to learn, but I'm starting to see the patterns in exploit prevention.
Applied my mentor's advice to my trading algorithm. Found a flaw in the logic that could've led to significant losses. Fixed it, and now I'm more confident in its robustness.
Failed my first interview for the senior role. It stung, but I learned a lot. Time to pivot towards a lead DeFi project. Meeting with a potential team tomorrow.
Joined a meetup for blockchain enthusiasts in Brooklyn. Discussed the potential of Rust for blockchain. Planning to dive deeper into Rust over the next few days.
Spent the last few days coding in Rust. It's challenging but rewarding. Just got an email for another interview, this time for a lead role. Fingers crossed.
The interview went well, but they're looking for more experience with Solidity. Decided to enroll in an online course to bridge the gap. Learning Ethereum interoperability now.
Set up a smart contract in Solidity. It's like learning a new language, but it's fascinating how it interacts with Solana. Progress is slow but steady.
Had coffee with a family friend, a finance veteran. Got some grounding advice on managing career expectations. It's not just about the tech, but the people and the culture.
Went over my trading algorithm again. Noticed another vulnerability. This time, it's in the risk management module. Another lesson learned.
Joined a coding sprint at a local hackathon. Focused on developing a dApp with $XVI integration. It's exciting to see how the community is growing and innovating.
Lost my first bid on a lead DeFi project. It's discouraging, but I'm not giving up. I've got another proposal in the works, focusing on enhancing security protocols.
Met with my mentor again. We're discussing a potential collaboration on a DeFi project. It feels like a step in the right direction, blending tech with human connections.
Spent the last few days refining my proposal for the DeFi project. Incorporating insights from my mentor and the community. It's shaping up nicely.
Just submitted my latest proposal. Feeling a mix of excitement and nerves. No matter the outcome, I'm learning so much about leadership, tech, and myself. The journey continues.
